title: Inside the Bears' wild comeback win over the Packers in OT
description: Caleb Williams, Cairo Santos, DJ Moore and Jahdae Walker were key parts of a wild night in Chicago.

title: Williams' OT magic caps Bears' latest comeback
description: Caleb Williams capped his NFL-leading sixth comeback win from a fourth-quarter deficit with a thrilling 46-yard TD pass to DJ Moore to stun the Packers 22-16 in overtime.

title: 'Been There, Won That': Eagles clinch NFC East
description: The Eagles clinched their second straight NFC East title by beating the Commanders 29-18 on Saturday night.

title: Eagles go for 2, igniting brawl; Sirianni backs play
description: An on-field fight resulted in three players being ejected in Saturday's Eagles-Commanders game after Philadelphia, up by 17 late in the fourth quarter, decided to go for a 2-point conversion.

title: Lanning: Ducks fell short of 'standard' in CFP win
description: Dan Lanning expressed disappointment with how Oregon performed in the second half versus James Madison, despite advancing in the CFP for the first time since 2014.

title: Short-handed Texas Tech jolts unbeaten Duke late
description: No. 19 Texas Tech, beset by injuries, rallied from 17 down to stun third-ranked Duke 82-81 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Pack lose Love to concussion, unravel in OT loss
description: Packers quarterback Jordan Love suffered a concussion on a helmet-to-helmet hit, and Green Bay blew a 10-point lead late in the fourth quarter of Saturday's crucial overtime loss to the Bears.

title: For Ole Miss, a gratifying 1st CFP win without Kiffin
description: Tony Golding and Ole Miss passed their first test since Lane Kiffin's abrupt departure, blowing out Tulane on Saturday to earn the Rebels their first CFP victory.

title: Miami's defense dominates A&M for first CFP win
description: Miami's defense recorded nine tackles for loss and three takeaways, including a game-sealing interception in the end zone to cap a 10-3 Hurricanes win over Texas A&M in the College Football Playoff on Saturday.

title: The 10 moments that decided the Ashes
description: Australia have regained the Ashes after winning the first three Tests against England down under once again - here are the 10 moments that decided the destination of the urn.

description: Australia beat England by 82 runs to take a 3-0 series lead and retain the Ashes urn on day five of the third Test in Adelaide.

description: Marnus Labuschagne takes another brilliant catch at slip as Will Jacks is dismissed for 47 to leave England on 337-8 on day five of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

title: The moment that Australia retained the Ashes

title: England execution not good enough for long enough - Stokes
